mythical.maze

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • mythical.maze.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a Grid that the game will be played on; includes blocks and characters.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid(int right, int bottom, int start, int end, int l)
      Constructor that takes 5 integers right, bottom, start, end and l and sets private final (constant) integers rightBound, bottomBound, startY, endY and level to these values, respectively.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addShape()
      Places the shape from the heads up display onto top, left corner of the grid.
      void checkDead()
      Checks if the level is lost by checking if blocks have overflowed the top.
      void checkRow()
      Checks to see if a row is complete and removes the row if it is complete
      void clearDeadBlocks()
      Removes all the blocks during the tutorial.
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics g, int gridSizeX, int gridSizeY, int uiArea)
      Draws the grid along with all its components after calculations.
      void drop()
      Drops the shape as far down as possible.
      boolean findPath(int xStart, int yStart, int xEnd, int yEnd)
      Algorithm that finds whether a correct path has been built using the blocks from start to finish.
      int getAddedScore()
      Returns the score that was gained during the level.
      Character getCharacter()
      Returns character reference.
      java.util.ArrayList<Block> getNonMovingBlocks()
      Returns the ArrayList of the blocks that are non-moving.
      boolean hasWon()
      Returns the value of hasWon as a boolean.
      boolean hasWonLevel()
      Returns the value of hasWonLevel as a boolean.
      boolean isDead()
      Returns the value of isDead as a boolean.

      Moves the character down if possible

      Moves the character to the left if possible.

      Moves the character to the right if possible.
      void moveCharacterUp(int x, int y)
      Moves the character up if possible.
      boolean moveDown()
      Checks to see if the current shape can move down if possible; if block cannot move down, this indicates that a new block must be created or the game has ended.
      void moveLeft()
      Moves the current block to the left if possible.
      void moveRight()
      Moves the current block to the right if possible.
      void nextShape()
      Creates a random shape and prepares to place on Heads up Display.
      Shape randomShape()
      Generates a random integer and returns corresponding shape.
      void removeRow(int y)
      Gets an integer y and removes the row corresponding to that integer by deleting all the blocks in the row
      void rotateLeft()
      Rotates the current shape counterclockwise (left) if possible.
      void rotateRight()
      Rotates the current shape clockwise (right) if possible.
      void startLevel()
      Prepares and adds 2 shapes for the beginning of the level.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid(int right,
            int bottom,
            int start,
            int end,
            int l)
        Constructor that takes 5 integers right, bottom, start, end and l and sets private final (constant) integers rightBound, bottomBound, startY, endY and level to these values, respectively.
        Parameters:
        right - the integer value indicating grid size (right boundary).
        bottom - the integer value indicating grid size (bottom boundary).
        start - the integer value representing the starting space.
        end - the integer value representing the end space.
        l - the integer value representing level.

      • moveDown

        public boolean moveDown()
        Checks to see if the current shape can move down if possible; if block cannot move down, this indicates that a new block must be created or the game has ended.
        Returns:
        canMove a boolean representing if the object can move down

      • removeRow

        public void removeRow(int y)
        Gets an integer y and removes the row corresponding to that integer by deleting all the blocks in the row
        Parameters:
        y - an integer that represents the row number that is to be removed

        public void drop()
        Drops the shape as far down as possible.

      • findPath

        public boolean findPath(int xStart,
                        int yStart,
                        int xEnd,
                        int yEnd)
        Algorithm that finds whether a correct path has been built using the blocks from start to finish.
        Parameters:
        xStart - the starting x coordinate value.
        yEnd - the end y coordinate value.
        yStart - the starting y coordinate value.
        xEnd - the end x coordinate value.
        Returns:
        true or false based on if there exists a solution.
